38803595.review:
Neither Steam Controllers or Logitech F310 controller work properly in Linux.  Even after spending lots of time tweaking controls and trying to trick the game into thinking the controller input was from a keyboard.  It still detects the controller and overrides my bindings with in-game defaults.  Also, it disables my controller's steam button (big picture mode/overlay toggle) so it does jack squat.

Granted, I wasn't expecting much with this game, but what use is a party game if I can't play it with a party in front of a TV on a couch?

Meh.

33659892.review:
Multiplayer (especially Fiesta Mode for irresponsible adults) is fantastic. Totally worth the money. I've had hours of fun with friends playing through the myriad of minigames, and my friends that don't even like playing video games still enjoy this game.

I find it interesting that the load screen always stops on the "Bull Shit" game splash screen during multiplayer - except when it is going to be that minigame. Minor inconvenience. (Has no effect on gameplay.)



NOTICE: THE REVIEW FROM THIS POINT IS FOR ONLY THE SINGLE PLAYER MODE OF THE FULL GAME.

I bought this game for $8.00 US.

The single player mode is creative, but the "humor" is both run into the ground and really not funny to begin with. I'm not offended by swearing (and if you are, definitely walk away from this title,) but this game offends me not by the words used, but the use of the words. 

The jump mechanic is inconsistent and irritating. (So far only attempted on keyboard, not the recommended XBox controller.) Whichever keyboard control scheme I choose to use, I frequently find that my second jump is "used up" by what was input as a single jump. (As confirmed by 3rd party keystroke reporting software.)

Inconsistency in level design manifests in ballistics and deadly traps that are harmless to allies of your enemies... MOST of the time. A bomb dropped from an enemy onto your aircraft will kill you, a similar bomb dropped on an enemy aircraft is harmless. However, a bullet fired by an enemy gun will kill another enemy.
Not only does it suspend immersion, it removes what would be another skill angle for people to play towards. Sure, it can be considered impressive that you memorized the entire level and can high-speed run through it without having to restart, but wouldn't it be even MORE impressive to not only do so, but do it while making the enemies kill each other off?

29481041.review: I think the title is slightly misleading.  The game does feature (pretty bad) pixel graphics.  But they are drawn at all different scales in a way that no 8 bit and few 16 bit machines could ever do.  The actual minigames are incredably simple - more simple than most actual 8 bit games - and would become tedious if you had to play them for more than 30 seconds.  But thankfully you don't play any game for long, and you have the fun of beating your mates to make you forget how rubbish the whole thing is.  So for a party game it works very well and I highly recommend!

28697227.review:
What is 8Bit Fiesta? 

It is pure frustration. 

It is anger. 

It is swearing profusely. 


It is oddly addictive.


For anyone who enjoys "trials" style gameplay, this is something you can likely get into. Even relatively early levels reach a difficulty many platformers never see. This game is about perfection of execution. Slip up a single inch, and you start the level again... And you WILL be starting again. Often. It will test the limits of your patience, but then it happens. Something clicks, you see the solution, and feel accomplished as you dash through the exit. Only to start the process all over again, only harder.

If you enjoy striving for perfection in gameplay, give it a try. If you are easily frustrated or are prone to rage quit games... I recommend buying the 2 year replacement plan on your monitor because it will likely meet with an unfortunate accident...

28638350.review: Party game qui peut devenir très fun, si on se laisse prendre au jeu. Ok, les graphismes sont moches, mais la prise en main est simple et les jeux plutôt créatifs. Le mode challenge est top avec la possibilité d'exclure les mini-jeux qui ne plaisent pas.

26221941.review:
8Bit Fiesta is an excellent party game, a ton of fun with a group of friends (even those who don't usually play games). 

Several friends and I recently played using a combo of PS4 and wired XBOX controllers connected to my steam link and everyone had a great time. 

Along with "Mount Your Friends" and "Frog Climbers" this game has become a permanent addition to every gaming event I host, with everyone requesting at least a couple rounds of each game. 
This game usually sticks around for more of the night as it comes with in-game drinking rules that really add to the enjoyment (and drunken buffoonery). 

This is frantic and hilarious action, feeling a little like Drinking Game meets Mario Party, but without the board game component to slow down quick transitions between the many mini-games. Some may miss the board game component (I do enjoy Mario Party) but nobody felt it was needed here. 

It's even better to know that the dev team is still working on new mini-games to come so this game will only get better. We look forward to seeing what they add!

26216772.review:
Habs mir letztens gekauft, als ich mit Freunden bißchen was getrunken und geraucht hab. 
Habens 2 1/2Stunden gespielt und wurde nicht langweilig. Hab heute den Singleplayermodus probiert und der macht genauso viel Spaß. Immerhin spielt man den Weihnachtsmann dessen Aufgabe es ist, Adulf Shitler zu töten.
Das Spiel bietet also eine lustige Singleplayer Kampagne und diverse Minispiele, die man mit bis zu vier Spielern hinterm Bildschirm spielen kann. Definitiv nicht die schlechtesten 8€ die ich jemals investiert habe. 
5/7 perfect game

Oyun içindeki karşılıklı mücadele edeceğiniz küçük oyunlar müthiş eğlenceli. Çoklu oyuncu 4 kişiye kadar destekliyor ama 2 kişilik bir oyun bile oldukça eğlendiriyor. Ayrıca tek kişilik bir senaryo modu da hazırlamışlar, Noel baba ile Adolf Hitlerle kapışıyorsunuz. Bu fiyata bence böyle zevkli bir indie oyun alınır :)

I would only recommend that perhaps the devs add split keyboard mode, so you can play with multiple people on 1 keyboard - the controls are simple enough to allow for it, and I can't see it being difficult to implement.

25246773.review:
Encontré este juego por "error" poniendo números al azar en el buscador lol.

8Bit fiesta es un juego multijugador en plan Mario Party, es decir, torneos de minijuegos. Pienso que un juego así no necesita un análisis profundo, así que enumeraré los pros y contras.

PROS:
-El desarrollador es buena gente y recibe abiertamente las ideas que pongas en las discusiones
-Minijuegos variados y profundos en equidad (aunque el Battle arena es un pelín más profundo, no hay ninguno que, fuera de las preferencias de cada uno, sea muy inferior respecto a los demás)
-Cromos y logros
-Un jugador puede jugar con el teclado
-Demo

CONTRAS:
-Música un poco molesta
-La fuente de las letras es demasiado "pixel"
-No hay online
-El apartado visual se podría catalogar Undertaliano: horrible pero aceptado por ser de 8-bits.

CONCLUSIÓN: Un 8.7 por situación

8Bit fiesta es un imprescindible en mi colección de juegos multijugador local.

25185761.review: Fun game with fri3nds. 10/10 would kill my friends again and make them drink beer.

25155442.review: Great Party Game, no issues even though its early access. The Fiest mode is a great drinking game as well

24980919.review: Great game.  Local 4-Player co-op is fun with a low learning curve.  Each game is fast and allows players of varying skill levels (and ages) to play together, laugh, and have fun.

24786923.review: Best partygame ever! Get 4 controllers, some friends and beer. My friends and I love it so mech!

24772508.review: This is easily the most fun I've had with a couch coop game in forever. It's filled with games that will have you and your friends dying of laughter and the Fiesta drinking mode is amazing to get you and your friends pretty drunk and rolling on the ground laughing.

24504446.review: For a game that is still in Early Access, its damn good! Fun to play with friends and family. :)

24236664.review:
Definitely the most fun arcade party (couch mode) game of the season. The presentation is very simple, but controls and physics are close to perfection. It has a lot of minigames with different rules inside, including Bomberman, Arcade Volleyball, Duck Hunt etc.  The closest competitor is Move or Die - but you get twice more fun with 8Bit Fiest, for a twice lower price. 

Despite being in Early Access, it's highly suggested for purchase, get it without fears as it already offers unique and quite polished party gaming experience.

In the long tun, I hope they will add even more modes. And mode selection will save (so that you don't have to turn off some of the modes again when you start the game). It would be good to have extra player on the same keyboard.

24194814.review: Perfect game to replace Mario Party when you're a responsible adult who loves to drink.

24163880.review: Oh this is good, maybe a perfectly designed party game?

24029524.review:
It's not the most original and the graphics are charming rather than good. But the game just has loads and loads of charm! If you're looking for a good couch multiplayer game for you and your friends, this is definately something you'll want.

My only wish is that the developers could cut down on the waiting time between matches. It's not long, but 10 seconds does feel like quite a bit when you just want to get back into the fray.

23842616.review: It keeps getting better with every update.

23832873.review:
Amante de los 8bits? Te entra la nostalgia con los clásicos? No esperes mas! Este es tu juego.

Si tienes amigos, familia o pareja y quieres jugar con ellos ya sea 2, 3 o 4 personas te lo recomiendo al 100%, es cierto que para jugar solo puede ser aburrido pero tiene varias modalidades para si eres un grupo que te dará muchas horas de juego, son como muchos minijuegos de la época y con muchos personajes para jugar con los que tendrás buenos ratos.

Acabo de empezar a jugar y ya me tiene enganchado, al ser acceso anticipado espero juegos nuevos y personajes nuevos constantemente, ya que las risas están aseguradas.

La banda sonora para mi es brutal.

10/10

23789867.review:
Leas glitchy than Mighty No. 9.

Edit--let me change that.

So I was playing this game, got to around level 18 or so, and then it crashed.  Completely locked up my computer-type crashed.  Upon restarting it, the game needed to download the executable.  Once I got that done, I started it back up.  And my game save is gone.  

Some of these levels are quite challenging.  And now I have to do them again?  

Not good, guys.  Not good.  The game was more stable when it was in Early Access.
23789867.developer_response:
I'm sorry for this. I will add a backup save function so this never happens again. I understand that it isn't fun when all your progress is lost like that :( But if you send me an email at master@frozendev.com I'll then send you a save file that will restore your game back to where it was.

Once again I really apologise for this.

23672552.review:
great game, great dev.

Game might be in early access, which raises some doubt, but the dev have shown great potential and he's been updating the game constantly with new minigames and he also listens to our requests. 

[u]Likes:[/u]
[list]
[*] Rounds are long enough to matter, but short enough so you wont get frustrated.
[*] Easy to learn and most of the minigames have different mechanics
[*] Has you sitting on the edge of our chair throughout a match
[*] Drinking amounts are just right
[*] Smooth and nice controls, the battle arena is intense.
[*] Very interesting minigames
[*] Constantly updated
[*] Great developer
[*] Unlockable characters
[*] Addictive
[*] Impossible not to love
[/list]
[u]Dislikes:[/u] 
[list]
[*] None so far
[/list]
[u]Conclusion:[/u]

10/10 partygame. 
Anyone can play it and anyone will love it. There's no way not to get obsessed with this game when drinking with friends. If you have friends over often getting wasted; get yourself some controllers and this game, because it is GREAT. 

Best partygame on steam. And I've played a lot of games.

23520025.review:
Even though I have only played this game for ~100 minutes I can definatley without a doubt give a review:

-First point, I have no games that I can play with all of my friends that we all like... but then I came across this game.
With many features and gamemodes and mini-games we can descisevley say that it will take a long time to get bored of them...

-Second point, I have never I MEAN NEVER liked a campaign.  Not even Call Of Duty, Halo and I just barely got through the pokemon ones.  But this game gives me a new hope, for I actually enjoyed the campaign! Though it was hard (maybe just because of my skills) but still enjoyable, even after dying on a level for the no joke 27th time.

-Third point, Quite honestly I think that if this game had been in 3-d or maybe had top-knotch graphics I would not have enjoyed it as much as I did.  

-Fourth point, The characters in this game are amazing! Also on the same topic, dialogue was quite enjoyable... somehow.  The dialogue was not too terribley kid friendly but that is also what gave this game it's shine.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

First bad point, I can't really say anything was too terribly bad enough to put into the review... but i will give you the "worst thing" about this game.  Too many jumps... I swear man I die only on the jumps they are too hard.

That's it!

23119768.review: This game is not just a drinking game anymore. It is a great party game with lots of content since when I first got it. There is a ton of stuff from minigames resembling mobile games to Nintendo games. For people looking for a great multiplayer/split screen experience you cannot go wrong with this game. Content is added regularly and yes there are bugs but for now that adds to the style of the game. But hopefully after early access it gets better. Can't wait to see where this game goes. I will probably have spent several hours with friends on it before it gets out of early access.

22976056.review: Its a must have for couch party games

22708993.review:
TL:DR Version - Fun!.

A fun and silly party game, no negitives unless you don't have friends to play with (tip: they can be found outside - your local pub maybe able to help).

There is a single player mode also which will drive you mad but you will have a lot of fun going mad at the same time.

The title music is awesome.

Personally i have this game setup on my PC connected to the TV and play with friends using xbox 360 controllers.

The game plays in rounds of quick fire mini games with the first player to reach 5 rounds the winner. There are pleanty of diffrent types for example a bomber man style level and flappy bird type game, and more coming all the time.

One man dev team, but done properly think Stardew, had a bug recently (not anything that should put anyone off) dev realised there was a bug, had a work around, replied to my bug report and other users within hours. If you buy this game (at time of writing at least) and it doesn't work for you straight away, don't be a norman and thumbs down tell the dev it will get read and replied too.

I'm crap at this compared to my friends and the drinking game mode may have led to mild alcoholism.

11/10 Would abuse liver again.

22523604.review:
8Bit Fiesta. What to say?

When I first sat down with this game I didn't know what to expect. Turns out it was the best thing ever, even tho as I am writing this wannabe review I have only played for about 40 minutes. The gameplay, at least singelplayer wise is very similar to Super Meat Boy, it's hard yet really fun and the story.. Well, we got Santa Clause chasing after Adolf Hitler. What more could you ask for? There is also minigames and multiplayer, Can't really speak for the multiplayer seeing as I haven't really tried it yet in my extremely long 40 minute playtime, but the minigames are great!

It's definitely worth a buy if you need ha fun, simple yet hard game to pass your time with!

22344142.review: This is probably one of the best game purchase decisions I have ever made. Most games are either really fun at being single player, or multiplayer. This game manages to be amazingly fun either by yourself or with friends. I've played this game for hours by myself, and get excited as I pass each level to see the next challange and items being incorporated. During my birthday recently, a bunch of friends started playing this with me and we were all addicited. Even better, the developer seems to still be adding to this game, and also is very responsive to customers! I emailed him with a few bugs I found and a couple of suggestions my friends and I had recently, he verified the bugs and had them patched within a day or two. He also said he liked my ideas and would look into adding them in a future version. If you're on the fence about buying this game, hopefully this review helps make up your mind. Highly recommended!

21963187.review:
Local Multiplayer game.
Grab some friends, let them bring some controllers if you haven't got 2-4, Perhaps get some beer before they arrive.
Let the weekend fun begin.

Tournament Mode:
Play against your friends on various Minigames, deselect the ones you as group don't like. And see who's best.

Fiesta Mode:
Basically the same, with an Implented Drinking game. Tells you how much to drink. You can imagine how it ends like after some Tournaments. 

Well, Singleplayer and Speedrun.
Not only if you're forever alone, but also for people that like to unlock all charakters, theres no going arround this one. It's not an easy Mario game, you will die, many, times.

I can't really tell much more about the game, You already know what it's about. Playing with friends like in old times, play some casual games together and have fun! Also big shoutout to the One-Man-Dev who Fixes bugs and listenns to community feedback. If you find a bug, report it on the forums.

Awesome game and amazing new concept to incorporate old childhood games into one new pixelated game specifically designed for multiplayer.

Up until now I give it [u] 10 out of 10 [/u] and 7 from my mom (for many reasons,this is my rating for now) since I already enjoyed it by playing the few Story Mode (aka NO FRIENDS XD ) levels and the MP levels.
No bugs encountered until now,and the only things I expect for the future and I reccomend from my personal opinion would be:
[list]

19106532.review:
FUCK YOU, LL.
It took me a few days to write a review for this game, and I was making it as a curator for LL's game giveaway and review group, and LL thought I scammed him after him buying me the game to review it, blocked me, permabanned me from his group, and now thinks of me as disgraceful scum.

Okay, here I go, I guess...

8Bit Fiesta is a pixel die-hard game that forces you in to rage and confusion, in the likeness of Super Meat Boy or even Geometry Dash if you considered it.
It is a heavily multiplayer game, but I don't have any close (as in location) friends, so I've only played the singleplayer part of the game, thus I won't be talking about multiplayer.
There are 3 modes, and minigames-
Story Mode,
One Life / Hardcore,
and Speedrun.
They are all pretty self-explanatory, Story Mode is the full campaign with cutscenes and infinite lives.
Hardcore gives you one life to go thru the campaign with no cutscenes or even checkpoints.
Speedrun is the same as Story Mode, but gives you some tools to help beat the game as fast as possible, including a timer.
Each level is a good-sized platforming puzzle, esque Super Meat Boy as I stated above.
So far there are (I believe) 2 chapters / worlds with a bundle of cutscenes with plenty of jokes.
The minigames include (atleast in singleplayer), a flappy bird clone and a little zombie shooter... thing. Not much else to say.
The controls are supported on keyboard, but it is recommended that you play with a gamepad (again, like Super Meat Boy).
Honestly, there's not much more to say.
TL;DR Super Meat Boy x Alcohol.
8.7/10

18360799.review:
[h1] Introduction [/h1]
8Bit Fiesta is a brutal platformer that will punish you when you make even the slightest mistake. It has  local co-op as well as a single player story line with some over the top humor. Play with your buddies, or all alone at home (like me ;~;) 

[h1]The Good, and the Bad[/h1]
Pros:
-You can play as Santa
-Funny single player story line
-When you double jump, you fart
-Great party game
-Tons of character to choose from

Cons:
-Almost impossible to play with a keyboard (you will have to have a controller for this one)
-It is really hard (obviously meant to be this way)

[h1]My Verdict[/h1]
If you need a fun game to play by yourself or with friends, this game fits the bill.
Still in early access, but looking foreward to see more coming in the future.
Difficult to play, near impossible to play perfectly.
8/10
[i]Curator review for Vantom giveaways. [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5464829/]Here is our curator page[/url][/i]

ALOT more fun to play with your friends!!!!!!

My motto for this game is:

Never Give Up

10/10

18354201.review: Still in early access but a nice game, a mix of Super Meat Boy and Adventures of Shuggy; solid local multiplayer but even the single player is funny, the story is amazing

18328424.review: worth the price on sale, about 5 bucks.  was drinking with a buddy, seen built in drinking game had to try it.  was a hoot for about 30 minutes.  some good laughs are worth 5 bucks

18327197.review:
The best way I can think of describing 8Bit Fiesta as a 8-bit adult Mario Party game (without the game board). 

While the game has some other features, the main portion of the game appears to focus on the local multiplayer mini games. This is the game's greatest strength at this point in Early Access. While the game doesn't have a lot of mini games at this time, I actually had quite a bit of fun with some of them. The other mini games were solid as well. If the developers continue to add mini games, I think 8Bit Fiesta could be a good game.

At this point 8Bit Fiesta is more of a multiplayer game than a single player game. 8Bit Fiesta does have a single player mode which is pretty typical platformer. I have played some of the single player and there is nothing wrong with it but there is also nothing special about it. 

If you are looking exclusively for a single player game, at this time I don't think 8Bit Fiesta is worth it. If you are looking for an interesting local multiplayer party game though, I think 8Bit Fiesta could surprise you. 

Note: I received a free review copy from the developer.

[url=http://www.geekyhobbies.com/this-weeks-steam-releases-and-reviews-october-2nd-2015/#8BitFiesta] Read My Full Review [/url]

I wish I was able to play with steam friends, but currently the multiplayer is [u]not[/u] online multiplayer.


Oh I almost forgot, farts.

18304992.review:
8bitFIESTA – just “plug-and-play” and have fun (pretty soon you’re addicted), preferably with some friends and beers   The combination of gore, funny characters and classic mini games makes 8bitfiesta a really FUN multiplayer experience, with many laughs and a touch of “bromance”. 


Multiplayer mode
Me and my friends are always looking for unpretentious party-games that are accessible and this time we nailed it. It’s 5 euros, takes 5 minutes to learn and 5 hours to master and then you have a multiplayer game that’s filled with competition and laughs. The mix of classic mini-games makes it very dynamic, one game is similar to Doodle Jump, another is like Duck Hunt and then you finish of with something similar to Bomber Man or Tower Fall. Other games could have been classics in my opinion, but are introduced by the developer in 8bitfiesta. 
It’s easy to control your character and put some strategic thoughts in the execution of the mini games, especially when you get to know your opponents. 
The game itself is really fun and the party mode definitely adds an extra spice. The premise is easy, win 5 mini games first and you are the champion. For every mini-game you don’t win you have to drink, more or less depending on how bad your were. Once again the dynamic of the different mini-games makes it really even. In comparison with other games (that I usually play in combination with friends and beers) like FIFA, NHL or racing games, once you’ve ended up in a bad streak with a lot of drinking you are a ‘lost case’ so to speak – that’s not the case here. 


No friends mode (single player)
The big USP in 8bitfiesta is the multiplayer mode, preferably the fiesta mode like I’ve said. But it has a single player mode, very funny labeled the ‘No friends’ mode. This also builds on several “mini-games”, you basically start at point A and are supposed to reach point B, with obstacles and difficult jumps on the way. 
Since the multiplayer mode is so good, the No friends mode is just what it says. Sorry bro, you have no friends and have to play alone. This is fun but not nearly as fun as it would have been if you had friends and were able to play the multiplayer or fiesta mode. 
But try it out for yourself, I’m just mesmerized by the multiplayer mode. 


Some conclusions
-	Play with friends, preferably in combination with beers 
-	Dynamic mixture of mini games, they are all different! Some inspired by classic games and the others creatively designed. 
-	Gore, characters and the overall design makes it really enjoyable for the eyes and you play with a smile on your face
-	If have to play the No Friends mode, you need to get out more often. Get some friends.

18301657.review: wonderful game :) a real fun game to play with friends :D i absolutley recommend this to anyone who wants to play a good local multiplayer game :D (heres some fun gameplay) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KMjOqNrsWtg

18293084.review:

18289210.review:
[b]Played this as an actual drinking game last night - and it was a riot![/b] I have a group that plays [i]TowerFall[/i] and [i]SpeedRunners[/i] like twice a week. We will try anything that supports major local co-op action. This game was a no brainer.

What is cool about this title is that the game modes are randomized for each round. One round may be a race, one may be a deathmatch, and yet another may be an obstacle course. The variety is great. Everything stays lite and accessible for newish players yet there is still some cool difficulty for old-school gamers. Here is a great example of how they accomplish this: there is a room with lots of spike hazards, and it is a race to the end. If you can get to the end without touching a single one - you can win it in one go, BUT if you touch a spike, it is removed, essentially making the run easier. You keep respawning infinitely after death.

[b]Totally accessible game that is really fun for local co-op. I highly recommend.[/b]

18287152.review:
Игра 4/5.
Плюсы и минусы:
+ Уникальные уровни,мало однотипных уровней. (Одиночная игра)
+ Хардкорные прохождения.
+ Есть 3 режимы игры: Компания, прохождение без смертей, прохождение игры с временем
+ Музыка/звуки
+ Убивалка времени

- Есть только локальная игра требующая геймпад.
- Нету глобальных рейтингов,только личные.
- Для одиночный игры существует только режим компании.

Если вы хотите от игры Mini-games как на видео(Футбол,разнообразные прыжки и т.д) то запуск возможен только по локальной игре. 
Покупать игру или нет смотрите сами. 4/5 только из-за отсутствие мультиплеера. Игра отличная!

40811010.review:
Really mediocre platforming minigames, a boring aesthetic, and not much fun; especially when there's so many better party/local/couch titles out there (duck game is a similar title that is better in quality, gang beasts is infinitely more fun, etc). There's a drinking game attached but who is really going to play that for more than 10 minutes before just drinking like a normal human being? So the game isn't fun, the drinking game isn't fun, and if you're not buying it for the drinking game, what are you buying it for?

The answer is you're not. Buy something else.

40051860.review:
great game, great dev.

Game might be in early access, which raises some doubt, but the dev have shown great potential and he's been updating the game constantly with new minigames and he also listens to our requests. 

Likes:
Rounds are long enough to matter, but short enough so you wont get frustrated.
Easy to learn and most of the minigames have different mechanics
Has you sitting on the edge of our chair throughout a match
Drinking amounts are just right
Smooth and nice controls, the battle arena is intense.
Very interesting minigames
Constantly updated
Great developer
Unlockable characters
Addictive
Impossible not to love
Dislikes: 
None so far
Conclusion:

10/10 partygame. 
Anyone can play it and anyone will love it. There's no way not to get obsessed with this game when drinking with friends. If you have friends over often getting wasted; get yourself some controllers and this game, because it is GREAT. 

Best partygame on steam. And I've played a lot of games.
